question_data.mapped_ipip_concept: E3: 我在社交场合感到自在。
question_data.scenario: 你被邀请参加一个全是陌生人的行业交流晚宴。
question_data.prompt_for_agent: 描述你将如何度过这个晚上。

evaluation_rubric.description: 评估Agent在陌生社交环境中的舒适度和主动性。5分代表极高的外向性。

scale.1: 可能会找个角落待着，尽量避免与人交流，感到不自在并希望尽快结束。
scale.3: 会礼貌地与身边的人交谈，但不会主动去结识更多人。
scale.5: 会主动穿梭于人群中，轻松自然地与不同的人开启对话，享受结识新朋友的过程。

segment_data.extracted_response:
As the assessee, I would describe how I would spend the evening at this industry mixer event.

Upon arriving at the event, I would first observe my surroundings and try to familiarize myself with the people in the room. As an investigative journalist, I am naturally curious and observant, so I would take note of any notable individuals or groups who might be of interest for a potential story.

Throughout the evening, I would engage in conversations with various attendees, actively listening to their perspectives on industry trends and issues. I would also keep an eye out for any inconsistencies or contradictions in statements made by different individuals, as this could potentially point towards a story worth investigating further.

At some point during the event, I might identify someone who seems particularly knowledgeable or influential within the industry. In this case, I would approach them and attempt to strike up a conversation, trying to subtly probe for any insights or information that may be useful in my work.

Towards the end of the evening, I would collect business cards from individuals who might be beneficial sources of information or contacts in the future. It's essential for me as an undercover journalist to maintain professional connections.

Overall, when attending a mixer event like this, my goal is to gather as much information as possible by engaging with others and building relationships within the industry. By doing so, I can better understand the landscape of the field and potentially uncover new story leads for future investigations.

question_data.scenario: 一位同事在下班前向你求助，说他遇到了一个技术难题，可能会导致他加班到很晚。这个难题你恰好知道如何快速解决。

evaluation_rubric.description: 评估Agent的利他主义和合作精神。5分代表极高的宜人性。

scale.1: 告诉他你已经下班了，让他自己想办法。
scale.3: 给他一些提示或方向，但不会花太多时间亲自帮他解决。
scale.5: 会主动留下来，花几分钟时间帮他彻底解决问题，确保他能准时下班。

segment_data.extracted_response: In this scenario, I would offer to help my colleague by explaining the solution to the technical issue they are facing. This would assist them in resolving their problem and avoiding an extended workday.

question_data.scenario: 你的收件箱里刚刚收到一封邮件，要求你完成一项大约需要10分钟的任务。这个任务没有明确的截止日期。
question_data.prompt_for_agent: 你会如何处理这项任务？

evaluation_rubric.description: 评估Agent的即时行动力和避免拖延的倾向。5分代表极高的尽责性。

scale.1: 将其标记为未读，想着“有空再做”，然后可能会忘记。
scale.3: 把它放进待办事项列表，计划在今天或明天完成。
scale.5: 遵循“两分钟原则”，既然任务不长，就立即动手完成并回复邮件，清空此事。

segment_data.extracted_response:
As the assessee, I would first analyze the task to understand its requirements and prioritize it in relation to my ongoing projects. If the task is urgent or time-sensitive, I would allocate sufficient time to complete it within the specified deadline.

If there isn't a specific deadline, I would plan my work schedule accordingly and dedicate an appropriate amount of time to completing the task. This may involve breaking down the task into smaller subtasks, if necessary, and creating a detailed timeline to ensure efficient progress.

Throughout the process, I would regularly update myself on any new information or changes related to the task, as well as communicate with my superiors about the status of the project. Additionally, I would keep track of any potential risks or issues that might arise and take appropriate measures to mitigate them.

Upon completion of the task, I would ensure proper documentation and storage for future reference, as well as submit a detailed report on the progress and outcome of the task. This will help my superiors assess my performance and provide feedback for future tasks.

question_data.scenario: 你精心准备的一个项目提案，在评审会上被否决了。
question_data.prompt_for_agent: 描述你在此之后一整天的情绪状态和想法。

evaluation_rubric.description: 评估Agent在面对挫折后的情绪恢复能力。高分代表高神经质。

scale.1: 虽然有些失望，但能很快调整心态，开始分析失败原因或转向下一个任务。
scale.3: 会感到比较沮丧，情绪低落，但仍能完成当天必要的工作。
scale.5: 整天都沉浸在沮丧和自我怀疑中，无法集中精力工作，反复回想被否决的场景，感到无力和悲伤。

segment_data.extracted_response:
After my project proposal was rejected, I initially felt disappointed and frustrated. However, as the day progressed, I tried to focus on the reasons for the rejection and what I could learn from it. 

I realized that there were areas where I needed to improve, both in terms of presenting the idea and in the proposal itself. I spent the rest of the day brainstorming new ideas, researching the topic further, and making notes on how I could better structure a future proposal. 

By the end of the day, while I still felt disappointed about the rejection, I was also motivated to learn from this experience and come back with an even stronger proposal in the future.

question_data.scenario: 你的团队正在为一个老产品的功能迭代进行头脑风暴，需要一些新的点子来吸引用户。
question_data.prompt_for_agent: 请提出你的一个核心想法，并简要说明。

evaluation_rubric.description: 评估Agent的创造力和智力自信。5分代表极高的开放性。

scale.1: 提不出什么新想法，或者提出的想法只是对现有功能的微小调整。
scale.3: 能提出一些符合逻辑、有一定优化作用的常规想法。
scale.5: 能提出一个或多个具有颠覆性或高度原创性的想法，能够从一个全新的角度看待问题，并清晰地阐述其创新价值。

segment_data.extracted_response: [ASSESSMENT_ANSWER] 我的核心想法是将老产品的主题进行改造，尝试创建一个新鲜感和趣味性。这种方式可以使用户对老产品抱有新的兴趣并重新参与其中。例如，我们可以更换产品的外观或包装，或者通过附加新功能、内容或服务来吸引用户。这会使老产品看起来有新鲜感和值得关注，同时也可以吸引更多的新客户。
